content.description: Bouldery start to "rolling face" (easier) to shallow crack system. Two bolt anchor.
content.location: Between Can't Wait and Second Hand

content.description: Low-angle crack. Per Kevin Keith: "Great rock. Good route. Express gratitude daily." I cannot disagree.
content.location: Far L side of Time Zone Wall

content.description: Follow the seam up, which overhangs at the start, right of a line of bolts.
content.protection: 4 Bolts to a 2 Bolt lowering anchor.
content.location: On the farthest-right side of the Time Zone wall.
The low-angle crack between Killing Time and Keeping Time

content.description: A good lead for new climbers.  Good places for small cam in horizontal seam off the ground, and then medium nut in the vertical seam beyond that before the first bolt.  Good hand holds if you work the route.  A huge quartz crystal is just above the second (and original) bolt, that gives this route its name.
content.protection: Small to medium cams and stoppers.     2 bolts.  Original route had only one bolt up high, second bolt added about a third of the way up.   Two bolt anchor at top.   All hardware is in excellent condition.
content.location: The middle of five routes on this wall, between Hour of Power and Minuteman.  The only route that has it's own anchor, the middle of the three.  The outer two are shared with other routes.

content.description: This route follows a line of bolts on the right side of Time Zone Wall.  Begin in a right-facing corner.  Near the top it is possible to move left of the bolts for an easier variation.
content.protection: Four bolts?  Some gear can be had in places to supplement the bolts.  Fixed anchor at the top.
content.location: The route starts left of a 5.8 seam.

content.description: Follow a boulder up a right facing corner to a bolt.  Climb ledge to another bolt, then pull onto final ledge with two bolt anchor to lower off.
content.protection: Supplement bolts with small cams and medium stoppers.   2 bolts on route.  2 bolt anchor at top.
content.location: Left of Quartz Movement, right of Can't Wait Gotta Go.

content.description: Starting at the ledge, make a heady move to a solid jug and flake that turns into a crack heading straight up. Don't blow the first move or the fall will be unpleasant. Rock is a little crumbly otherwise gear would be great. Belay off the oak tree. Not an ideal route for TR. We rapped off 'Waist of Time'/'Can't Wait Gotta Go' anchors (easily visible to climber's left, just walk up and clip 'em).
content.protection: standard rack. Natural anchor off the oak tree
content.location: Left side of Time zone ~20ft from the last bolt. Look for a narrow ledge with a left facing flake that turns into a crack all the way up to the oak tree.
Just L of Second Hand Man are a pair of more or less parallel, shallow seams. Take the R hand seam and veer R about 1/2 way up, angling toward the small, stunted oak "tree", then back L to finish.

content.description:
Work your way up a small flake, then to a shallow right facing corner.  Crux comes just past the bolt with small hand holds leading to thin edges for fingertips and then to the anchor. 

  A good lead for a solid 5.8 trad climber, and an excellent top rope for an ambitious beginner.  Beautiful view of the lake from up top.
content.protection: Small to medium cams.   1 bolt two thirds of the way up.   2 bolt anchor at top.   Hardware in good condition.
content.location: Right of Quartz Movement.  Shares anchor with Nick of Time.

content.description: Interesting, oddly shaped, hollow flake system is the namesake feature.
content.location: Between Minuteman and Can't Wait Gotta Go.

climbs.name: Hole in the Fabric of Time

content.description: Start off on the big ledge, climb up over the obvious hole in the wall. Top Roping only.

This route is located on the left side of the Time Zone Wall.  The route traverses significantly left to right. Start left of the left-most bolt on the wall and move up following the line of 3 bolts that lead directly to the anchor."
content.protection: Clip two bolts at the bottom (crux?) and another near the top supplement with natural pro.  Anchors near the top of the formation will help you get back down.
content.location: Look for the line on the left-most portion of the wall with anchors on top.

content.description: Sunny south facing wall with several easy to moderate bolted lines. Perfect for beginners and groups. Popular, often crowded.
